Html:
Should we add logging into the library? e.g. log4net

I've found to debug some issues logging has been really useful, but then I've removed it all before committing. 

We could toggle logging on off via a compiler switch (DEBUG?) maybe so as not affect performance at all in release.

Thoughts?

I'm good with that, seeing as we are the only two active developers.

This seems like an interesting, low cost approach.

http://devlicio.us/blogs/rob_reynolds/archive/2012/12/15/introducing-this-log.aspx

That looks pretty cool. I'd prefer log4net as the underlying logger (which is what he show in his gist anyway). Do you fancy doing it? Or I am happy to.


On Wed, Dec 19, 2012 at 12:51 PM, RyanONeill1970 <notifications@codeplex.com> wrote:

I'm good with that, seeing as we are the only two active developers.

This seems like an interesting, low cost approach.
